messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V2N is beta Vanadium nitride structured and crystallizes in the trigonal P-31m space group. V(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to one N(1) and two equivalent N(2) atoms. The V(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.99 Å. Both V(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 1.99 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to six equivalent V(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NV6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 49°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent V(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 49°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.082968217361111 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V2N3 crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. V(1) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner and edge-sharing VN6 pentagonal pyramids. All V(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.05 Å. All V(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.03 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to six equivalent V(1) atoms to form edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to three equivalent V(1) and one N(2) atom. The N(2)-N(2) bond length is 1.34 Å. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.9860095244999991 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V32N3 crystallizes in the monoclinic P2/m space group. There are sixteen inequivalent V sites. In the first V site, V(1) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to two equivalent V(11), two equivalent V(8), and two equivalent N(2) atoms. Both V(1)-V(11) bond lengths are 2.69 Å. Both V(1)-V(8) bond lengths are 2.71 Å. Both V(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.03 Å. In the second V site, V(2) is bonded in a 14-coordinate geometry to one V(10), one V(13), one V(6), two equivalent V(12), two equivalent V(7), three equivalent V(2), and four equivalent V(16) atoms. The V(2)-V(10) bond length is 2.99 Å. The V(2)-V(13) bond length is 2.82 Å. The V(2)-V(6) bond length is 2.99 Å. Both V(2)-V(12) bond lengths are 2.65 Å. Both V(2)-V(7) bond lengths are 2.63 Å. There is one shorter (2.84 Å) and two longer (2.97 Å) V(2)-V(2) bond lengths. All V(2)-V(16) bond lengths are 2.58 Å. In the third V site, V(3) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to two equivalent V(10), two equivalent V(6), and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both V(3)-V(10) bond lengths are 2.67 Å. Both V(3)-V(6) bond lengths are 2.67 Å. Both V(3)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.04 Å. In the fourth V site, V(4) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to two equivalent V(5), two equivalent V(9), and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both V(4)-V(5) bond lengths are 2.71 Å. Both V(4)-V(9) bond lengths are 2.71 Å. Both V(4)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.03 Å. In the fifth V site, V(5) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(15), two equivalent V(4), and four equivalent V(11) atoms. Both V(5)-V(15) bond lengths are 2.48 Å. There are two shorter (2.56 Å) and two longer (2.58 Å) V(5)-V(11) bond lengths. In the sixth V site, V(6) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to one V(2), two equivalent V(16), two equivalent V(3), and four equivalent V(12) atoms. Both V(6)-V(16) bond lengths are 2.58 Å. There are two shorter (2.49 Å) and two longer (2.67 Å) V(6)-V(12) bond lengths. In the seventh V site, V(7) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(10), two equivalent V(13), two equivalent V(2), and two equivalent V(9) atoms. Both V(7)-V(10) bond lengths are 2.52 Å. Both V(7)-V(13) bond lengths are 2.52 Å. Both V(7)-V(9) bond lengths are 2.59 Å. In the eighth V site, V(8) is bonded in a 8-coordinate geometry to two equivalent V(1), two equivalent V(10), two equivalent V(14), and two equivalent V(9) atoms. Both V(8)-V(10) bond lengths are 2.63 Å. Both V(8)-V(14) bond lengths are 2.47 Å. Both V(8)-V(9) bond lengths are 2.54 Å. In the ninth V site, V(9) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(15), two equivalent V(4), two equivalent V(7), and two equivalent V(8) atoms. Both V(9)-V(15) bond lengths are 2.49 Å. In the tenth V site, V(10) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to one V(2), two equivalent V(16), two equivalent V(3), two equivalent V(7), and two equivalent V(8) atoms. Both V(10)-V(16) bond lengths are 2.57 Å. In the eleventh V site, V(11) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(1), two equivalent V(14), and four equivalent V(5) atoms. Both V(11)-V(14) bond lengths are 2.51 Å. In the twelfth V site, V(12) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(13), two equivalent V(2), and four equivalent V(6) atoms. Both V(12)-V(13) bond lengths are 2.48 Å. In the thirteenth V site, V(13) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to one V(2), two equivalent V(12), two equivalent V(7), and one N(1) atom. The V(13)-N(1) bond length is 1.92 Å. In the fourteenth V site, V(14) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to two equivalent V(11), two equivalent V(8), and one N(1) atom. The V(14)-N(1) bond length is 1.92 Å. In the fifteenth V site, V(15) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to two equivalent V(5), two equivalent V(9), and one N(2) atom. The V(15)-N(2) bond length is 1.93 Å. In the sixteenth V site, V(16) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(10), two equivalent V(6), and four equivalent V(2) atoms. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to one V(13), one V(14), two equivalent V(3), and two equivalent V(4) atoms to form edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to two equivalent V(15) and four equivalent V(1) atoms to form edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.283197219321428 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V3N4 crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/m space group. V(1) is bonded to two equivalent N(2) and four equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of face, corner, and edge-sharing VN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 43-47°. Both V(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.10 Å. There are a spread of V(1)-N(1) bond distances ranging from 1.94-2.09 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent V(1) atoms to form distorted face-sharing NV6 pentagonal pyramids. In the second N site, N(1) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to four equivalent V(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.9825537337499971 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V4N3 crystallizes in the tetragonal I4/mmm space group. There are two inequivalent V sites. In the first V site, V(1) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to two equivalent N(1) and two equivalent N(2) atoms. Both V(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.01 Å. Both V(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.04 Å. In the second V site, V(2) is bonded to one N(2) and four equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing VN5 square pyramids. The V(2)-N(2) bond length is 2.03 Å. All V(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.04 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to two equivalent V(1) and four equivalent V(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-1°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to two equivalent V(2) and four equivalent V(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.142902738035713 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V4N3 is MAX Phase-derived structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three V4N3 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent V sites. In the first V site, V(1) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing VN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All V(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.06 Å. All V(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.10 Å. In the second V site, V(2) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All V(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.96 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent V(1) and three equivalent V(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 2°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent V(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 2°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.07457137517857 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

V8N crystallizes in the tetragonal P4_2/mnm space group. There are three inequivalent V sites. In the first V site, V(1) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to four equivalent V(3) and one N(1) atom. All V(1)-V(3) bond lengths are 2.49 Å. The V(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.93 Å. In the second V site, V(3) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to two equivalent V(1), two equivalent V(2), and four equivalent V(3) atoms. Both V(3)-V(2) bond lengths are 2.71 Å. All V(3)-V(3) bond lengths are 2.57 Å. In the third V site, V(2) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to four equivalent V(3) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both V(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.03 Å. N(1) is bonded to two equivalent V(1) and four equivalent V(2) atoms to form edge-sharing NV6 octahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.37719657319444305 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

All V(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.92 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent V(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NV4 tetrahedra.
